page.title: 06Swainston Nursery.
page.content: To the side of Swainston Manor there are a number of glasshouses which form Swainston Nursery.Beyond the nursery there is managed woodland. Three men work in the glasshouses which are used for growing{flowers and {vegetables.}The relatively mild climate of the Isle of Wight favours this kind of horticulture. A heating system is used during the colder periods of the year. The plants include{runner beans, courgettes, {lettuce,primroses, carnations and {chrysanthemums.}The flowers are sold to florists in Newport, Freshwater or sent to Southampton. Most of the vegetables are sold locally. Some of the glasshouses are not being used and two are derelict.
